titulo: It's not just the food - it's a tourist attraction!
conteudo:
We stayed in Diamantina for 3 nights and weren't so enthusiastic about the city, but one of the consensual standouts for the family was this restaurant run by a dedicated and enthusiastic chef, Raquel.

It's located slightly away from the 2 or 3 streets where many of the other well-known restaurants and bars are, but in a way, it stands out at the corner which it occupies. It's only open for dinner during weeknights and its lights and then its decor are quite attractive by themselves.

Then, there is a really nice and creative variety of dishes. We went there for 2 dinners. During both, someone in the family had risotto - either with shrimp or with sausage. The quantity was very satisfying for a Brazilian adult for dinner (we usually eat less than North Americans during that meal). Our daughter enjoyed the spaghetti al pesto one day and the black bean cream on the other. My wife had the shimeji cream one evening, I had the pulled pork. Of those dishes, the risottos would be the most recommended, though all of them tasted very nice.

My wife and I also enjoyed a local craft beer - the Capistrana red ale and the Vienna lager were both outstanding. I didn't get a chance to try their caipirinha with the Boazinha cacha√ßa, which I know from a restaurant in Bras√≠lia and is one of my absolute favorite.

I'm not sure about the service in the English language, but both the waiter and the waitress who were there for both dinners were really very friendly and efficient.

I hope this eatery will survive the challenging pandemic period and stay open for years to come!

Interesting place close to the main square with retro decoration and interesting menu. Ask for the artisanal beer menu and try some delicious snacks. The executive chef is very simpatic lady always present in the restaurant and recommending the best from the menu.
we had risottos, which were good. we thought the menu was limited, mostly risottos variations.High price for the wine, service added to the bill.

It's basically a hot plate with grilled meats and french fries or macaxeira fries on top! Great food and big enough for a group of at least 4 people. I've eaten it with as many as 8 people.
